title: Sri Lanka keep semis hopes intact at U19 World Cup
byline: A powerful display ensured that the second semi-final spot from Group 1 of the Super Six remains up for the grabs.

title: Archer named in England side for first T20
byline: Fast bowler Jofra Archer has been named in England’s team to face Sri Lanka in the first T20 match after recovering from injury.

title: Sri Lanka boosts T20 World Cup security with eye on India–Pakistan games
byline: Sri Lanka will deploy elite armed units to protect teams at next month’s T20 World Cup, part of enhanced security measures with a special emphasis on matches between perennial rivals India and Pakistan, officials have told AFP.

title: Former deputy Speaker alleged to have received Rs.200,000 in disaster compensation: MP
byline: A former Deputy Speaker is alleged to have received Rs.200,000 as compensation, claiming that his business establishment was damaged during the recent disaster.

title: Nine child marriages and 79 teenage pregnancies recorded last year: NCPA
byline: The National Child Protection Authority (NCPA) reported receiving a total of 10,455 complaints related to children last year, including nine cases of child marriage and 79 teenage pregnancies, highlighting ongoing concerns about child welfare in Sri Lanka. Of the total complaints, 8,514 fell under the NCPA Act, while 1,941 were outside its direct mandate.

title: Cyclone Ditwah donor conference in Sri Lanka still in limbo
byline: The planned international donor conference to raise funds for rebuilding areas affected by Cyclone Ditwah in Sri Lanka continues to be delayed, with no fixed date finalised as of yesterday, government sources revealed.

title: “Beautiful country with huge potential”: IMF’s  Dr. Srinivasan on Sri Lanka
byline: Sri Lanka’s economic recovery plans face new uncertainties after Cyclone Ditwah, but the International Monetary Fund (IMF) signalled continued support this week as it assessed the storm’s impact on the island

title: Trump threatens tariffs on countries supplying Cuba with much-needed oil
byline: United States President Donald Trump has signed an executive order to impose new tariffs on any country that supplies oil to⁠ Cuba, the latest move in Washington’s campaign of pressure on Havana.

title: Former Aviation Chairman removed due to changes in administrative structure: Ministry clarifies
byline: While refuting media reports over the removal of former Chairman of the Airports and Aviation Company, Hasha Abeywickrama, the Ministry of Ports and Civil Aviation said the letter sent to Venerable Banagala Upatissa Thera has no connection whatsoever to the removal of the former chairman from his position.

title: Public urged to beware of bank and police impersonation scams: CERT
byline: Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (Sri Lanka CERT) has issued a public warning over a surge in financial fraud cases involving bank and police impersonation scams, urging the public to remain vigilant and avoid sharing personal or financial information.

title: Real issue behind education reforms is competence not mentality: Sajith
byline: With regard to the recent remarks made by Minister Nalinda Jayatissa that the government should examine the Opposition Leader’s mental stability before implementing education reforms, the latter said the issue with regard to the situation is the competence of the Minister.

title: Order on Balangoda Kassapa Thera’s writ petition postponed for February 3
byline: The Court of Appeal today re-fixed February 03 to deliver its order on the interim relief sought by two Buddhist monks, including Ven. Balangoda Kassapa Thera, who are currently in remand custody for placing a Buddha statue in Trincomalee.

title: American Airlines plans to resume US flights to Venezuela after Trump moves to open airspace
byline: American Airlines (AAL.O), said on Thursday it planned to resume services to Venezuela for the first time in more than six years pending government approval and subject to security assessments, just weeks after the U.S. military seized the country’s leader.

title: Special traffic plan for Independence Day rehearsals
byline: A special traffic plan will be implemented in Colombo from today in preparation for the 78th National Independence Day celebrations.

title: Rs. 100Mn allocated for 78th Independence Day celebrations
byline: The government has allocated Rs. 100 million from the budget 2026 for the 78th Independence Day celebrations, Secretary to the Ministry of Public Administration, Provincial Councils Aloka Bandara said yesterday.

title: CID failed to record statements from University of Wolverhampton officials: Lawyers allege
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) team that visited the United Kingdom to probe the authenticity of an invitation received by former President Ranil Wickremesinghe failed to record statements from officials of the University of Wolverhampton, lawyers representing the former President alleged yesterday.

title: Agreement signed to increase plantation workers’ salaries
byline: The Ministry of Plantations and Community Infrastructure and the Sri Lanka Planters’ Association today (30) signed an agreement to increase the salaries of plantation workers, the Ministry said.

title: Sri Lanka’s Sabina Yousaf named second runner-up at Mrs. World 2025
byline: Sri Lanka earned international recognition at the 41st Mrs. World pageant as Sabina Yousaf was named Second Runner-Up, marking a proud achievement for the country at the prestigious global competition.

title: EU adds Iran’s Revolutionary Guards to terrorist list
byline: The European Union has added Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) to its terrorist list in response to Tehran’s deadly crackdown on protesters in recent weeks.

title: PM pledges safe, tech-driven digital education for Sri Lankan children
byline: Sri Lanka will move towards a carefully regulated digital education system that protects children while maximising the benefits of modern technology, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said, outlining plans to ensure that digital devices received under foreign aid are used efficiently, safely, and equitably across the school system.

title: Human trafficking allegations: SLBFE moves against ‘Dubai Sudda’
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) has initiated legal action in connection with a large-scale human trafficking and foreign employment scam allegedly operated by a Sri Lankan national based overseas under the name “Dubai Sudda.”

title: Indonesian couple caned 140 times for sex and alcohol offences
byline: A couple in Indonesia has been caned 140 times for having sex outside marriage and drinking alcohol because it violates Sharia, or Islamic religious law.

title: Health trade unions unite under GMOA banner
byline: A high-level discussion was held yesterday (29) between the Executive Committee of the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) and representatives of all health sector trade unions aimed at forging a unified approach to issues affecting the public health service.

title: Advisory council appointed to drive textile and apparel industry development
byline: An Advisory Council for the Development of the Textile and Apparel Manufacturing Industry was formally appointed yesterday (29) under the patronage of Industries and Entrepreneurship Development Minister Sunil Handunnetti.

title: Sri Lanka Police operating with 32,000 officer shortfall: IGP
byline: Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasuriya has highlighted a severe shortage of manpower within the Sri Lanka Police, revealing that the force is currently operating with an approximately 32,000-officer shortfall.

title: WHO says Nipah virus risk low in India with no sign of spread
byline: A World Health Organization official said on Friday that the risk of the spread of the Nipah virus is low, saying that none of the over 190 contacts of the two people infected in India had tested positive or developed symptoms of the disease.

title: Strict ban on bringing cigarettes into Sri Lanka
byline: Sri Lanka Customs has reiterated that it is strictly prohibited for any passenger arriving from abroad to bring cigarettes, warning that offenders will face severe penalties under the law.

title: Wild elephant rescued from Digampatha garbage dump in Dambulla
byline: A wild elephant that had fallen into the Digampatha garbage dump in the Dambulla Divisional Secretariat was safely rescued following a prompt operation by wildlife officials, the Wildlife Department said.

title: Riverston reopens to tourists under strict restrictions after Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The Knuckles’ Riverston tourist zone, a designated World Heritage area, has been reopened to local and foreign tourists under strict restrictions following the devastation caused by Cyclone Ditwah, the Matale District Secretary, Prasanna Madanayake, said.

title: New transport links planned to ease tourist travel
byline: Digital entry passes for tourist attractions and measures to fast-track tourist visa processing were among the key topics discussed at a meeting held this morning (30) at the Presidential Secretariat, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Firearm owners urged to renew licences
byline: The Ministry of Defence has issued a special announcement urging all individuals and institutions holding firearm licences to ensure that their licences are renewed for 2026, as the renewal period ends tomorrow (31).

title: Colombo bourse ends lower despite heavy block activity
byline: Sri Lanka’s equity market closed on a negative note on Friday, with both benchmark indices ending in the red, even as overall turnover remained robust, supported by heavy block activity and renewed interest from value investors.
